title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
China Evergrande said it was working to raise fresh funds after it disclosed that banks had taken control of more than $2 billion held by a subsidiary.

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gaining 1.1%, 2% and 0.7%, respectively. Government bond yields jumped.

A Koch Industries unit has made at least 10 investments worth at least $750 million in the U.S. battery supply chain and electric vehicles in the past 18 months.

Small groups of Disney employees across the U.S. took off from work and gathered to protest what they described as the company's continued failure to support LGBT employees.

The criminal-fraud trial began for Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani, former president of the defunct blood-testing company Theranos.

Canadian Pacific Railway and the union representing its conductors and engineers agreed to shift stalled contract negotiations to binding arbitration.

What's News: Business & Finance
